messages: 4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (15:14): dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb, are OMTP BONDI's specs such as their "Editor Drafts" publicly readable?
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (15:21): 4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27: I don't think so
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (15:21): It would be nice to get some transparency to their process
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (15:28): dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8ebo. OK. The APIs Marcin proposed like Tasks API and Logging API - are they included in the BONDI 1.0 Release Candidate?
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (15:36): Artb, I don't think so
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (15:37): Those are not really "device API"
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (15:42): Artb, should I bother editing the i18n document to reflect the WG's decisions and so to outline the complete solution?
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (15:58): dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb, re L10N doc - I think your #1 priority should be to implement the decisions in the spec, ASAP

dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:00): Yes, but I don't want to screw it up. I'm going to do this: 1. remove all rejected proposals from the i18n doc. 2. integrate feedback, corrections to agreed on proposals 3.
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:00): 3. send new doc to i18n
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:12): Couldn't you just do that in the context of a new version of the ED (rather than continue to update a separate doc)?
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:22): Artb, yes, I'm going to fold all the proposals into the P&C WD.
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:23): I wrote the proposals in "spec-ise" so they could be easily folded in.
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:24): When you say "all of the proposals", dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb, you mean just those that were agreed, right?
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:24): right

4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:25): 8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393, dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb, did you look at hendry's email re Identifier prop (http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-webapps/2009AprJun/0457.html)? What would break if that property was removed from the spec?
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:29): just sent an answer

8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:29): baiscally, nothing breaks in the user agent, but it's a really good idea to be able to reference things that have any importance in a standardized way.  Signatures are important. Keep it.
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:31): I think if distributors want to manage their certs, they should do so by making use of the Identifier. UAs should not be forced to support it
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:31): UAs will largely ignore it.
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:31): Does the spec say anything else right now?
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:32): checks

4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:33): The signer uses the dsp:Identifier signature property to uniquely identify the signature to enable signature management. It MUST be unique for a given signer. Signing parties are expected to ensure that the dsp:Identifier signature property value is unique for the widget packages that they sign.

dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:33): [[A unique identifier string for the signature MUST  be placed in the dsp:Identifier signature property by the signer. This MUST be a unique signing string for all widget signatures created by the signer. Signing parties are expected to ensure that the dsp:Identifier signature property value is unique for the widgets that they sign.]]
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:33): how could the uniqueness requirement ever be guaranteed?
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:34): it can't
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:34): so something's broken
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:34): perhaps this entire section should be Non-Normative
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:35): i.e. no more than a recommendation?
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:35): I agree
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:35): Good catch Hendry!
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:38): Artb, another offending line is:

dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:38): [[Each widget signature MUST contain a dsp:Identifier signature properties element compliant with XML Signature Properties [XMLDSIG-Properties] and this specification.
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:38): Artb, can you please make sure that Frederick sees the above
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:39): (otherwise, I can just paste all this into an email and ship it to public webapps)
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:40): Re uniqueness, there are several ways for a signer to guarantee it.
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:41): (a) large random number -- once it's more likely for planet earth to destroyed by Vogons than for a collission to occur, you're safe
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:41): (b) local serial number + DNS-based authority
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:42): there is no way for the UA to verify that, though
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:42): so, I don't think there's anything offending in here.
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:42): the notion of a "unique identifier" surely isn't objectionable all by its own.
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:43): => please keep normative and please don't remove
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:43): 8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393, I'm "offended" that the UA does not do anything with this
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:43): 8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 - understood but I think it would be good to qualify the "target" of the requirement is not the UA but the Signer
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:43): artb, no problem with having the target clear
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:43): i.e., "signers MUST put the dsp:Identifier element in there"
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:44): so, if the signer wants to use dsp:Indentifier, it should be left to the discretion of the signer. I don't see why it's a MUST that the id be included
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:45): does not say it's a bad thing, just that it don't do nothing at the moment.
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:45): there are some use cases -- e.g. signature revocation -- that will only work if a signature is *always* in the certificate.
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:45): Therefore, MUST.
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:46): so, it's to target specific signatures?
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:46): Do we need to specify how to do signature revocation?
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:47): we might need to at some point
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:49): dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb, my recollection is we said no to revocation for v1
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:51): sighs. "The purpose of a signature is to revoke it." or expire it. Or something.
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:56): 8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393, what are you quoting i.e. "The purpose of a signature is to revoke it"?
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:56): random themes, not any particular book
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:57): The point is simply that, without revocation or expiration, you have an attack surface that's unlimited in time once a signature key gets compromised
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:57): and that's fairly bad
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:58): unfortunately, revocation regularly fails, and it would be a mircale if we were to get a *working* revocation model built here
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (17:00): ah, so we'd need to boil the ocean to get it right
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (17:01): very likely

dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:01): 8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393, you say the purpose of a signature is to revoke it, but then we add in this dsp:Identifier thing and we don't define how to make use of it to revoke the signature
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (17:01): the identifier is in the catebory of "give others a hook to fix the problem"
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (17:02): s/catebory/category/
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:02): starts to worry
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (17:03): thinks dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb shouldn't.
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (17:03): To be clear, expiration for SSL doesn't work over the Internet because too many people break it.
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (17:03): revocation
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (17:03): expiration actually kind of works, but too many user agents give people a chance to click by
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (17:03): there is no particular reason why revocation here needs to work better (or worse) than it does for SSL.

8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (17:04): However, I'm positively sure that the amount of time we're spending here on arguing over the identifier is way above the amount of time it'll cost anybody to implement it.
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (17:04): has a meeting
